name: Death Dojo
description: Enter Death Dojo... A one-on-one death match to become the ultimate samurai.Real battle is scary. Other games may lead you to believe you can slash through hoardes of foes with ease. This is not true. To beat your enemy you must face your fears. In Death Dojo you must face your nightmare and defeat him.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 or newer Processor: Intel® i5-4590 / AMD FX 8350 equivalent or greater Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce® GTX 970 / AMD Radeon™ R9 290 equivalent or greater Storage: 600 MB available space

reviews.review_text: That was a neat little game, totally worth checking out for free. I'd love to see more done with it.   I struggled with what I thought was bad collision detection on the last level, but after sticking with it for a while I got used to it and it seemed pretty fair. It requires a bit more effort than moving the sword in the direction of the attack, it's more like slashing the opponent's slash. Once I got that down the last fight was a nice tense experience.  Rather than just being able to slash whenever you want as some have suggested, I'd like to see a system that makes you think about the right time to attack, and punishes you for choosing poorly. Otherwise it would just be about spamming slashes.

Cool looking but the fighting/game itself is pretty boring as you only have 2 to 3 options where you can cut/block. It would be better if it was a full on cut and stab where you want game!!!! it's free to have a go at, so test and you might like it but it not my cup of tea.... sorry but i can recommend!!
Very fun game. Love the realism and the atmosphere! Easy controls and challenging enemies make this an above-average VR expirience.
